013package org.apache.juneau.common.internal;
014
015import java.io.*;
016
017/**
018 * Various utility methods for creating and working with throwables.
019 */
020public class ThrowableUtils {
021
022   /**
023    * Interface used with {@link Utils#safeSupplier(SupplierWithThrowable)}.
024    */
025   @FunctionalInterface
026   public interface SupplierWithThrowable<T> {
027
028      /**
029       * Gets a result.
030       *
031       * @return a result
032       * @throws Throwable if supplier threw an exception.
033       */
034      T get() throws Throwable;
035   }
036
037   /**
038    * Creates a new {@link RuntimeException}.
039    *
040    * @param cause The caused-by exception.
041    * @return A new {@link RuntimeException}, or the same exception if it's already of that type.
042    */
043   public static RuntimeException asRuntimeException(Throwable cause) {
044      return cast(RuntimeException.class, cause);
045   }
046
047   /**
048    * Casts or wraps the specified throwable to the specified type.
049    *
050    * @param <T> The class to cast to.
051    * @param type The class to cast to.
052    * @param t The throwable to cast.
053    * @return Either the same exception if it's already the specified type, or a wrapped exception.
054    */
055   public static <T> T cast(Class<T> type, Throwable t) {
056      try {
057         return type.isInstance(t) ? type.cast(t) : type.getConstructor(Throwable.class).newInstance(t);
058      } catch (Exception e) {
059         throw new IllegalArgumentException(e);
060      }
061   }
062
063   /**
064    * Same as {@link Throwable#getCause()} but searches the throwable chain for an exception of the specified type.
065    *
066    * @param c The throwable type to search for.
067    * @param <T> The throwable type to search for.
068    * @param t The throwable to search.
069    * @return The exception, or <jk>null</jk> if not found.
070    */
071   public static <T extends Throwable> T getCause(Class<T> c, Throwable t) {
072      while (t != null) {
073         t = t.getCause();
074         if (c.isInstance(t))
075            return c.cast(t);
076      }
077      return null;
078   }
079
080   /**
081    * Convenience method for getting a stack trace as a string.
082    *
083    * @param t The throwable to get the stack trace from.
084    * @return The same content that would normally be rendered via <c>t.printStackTrace()</c>
085    */
086   public static String getStackTrace(Throwable t) {
087      var sw = new StringWriter();
088      try (var pw = new PrintWriter(sw)) {
089         t.printStackTrace(pw);
090      }
091      return sw.toString();
092   }
093
094   /**
095    * Calculates a 16-bit hash for the specified throwable based on it's stack trace.
096    *
097    * @param t The throwable to calculate the stack trace on.
098    * @param stopClass Optional stop class on which to stop calculation of a stack trace beyond when found.
099    * @return A calculated hash.
100    */
101   public static int hash(Throwable t, String stopClass) {
102      var i = 0;
103      while (t != null) {
104         for (var e : t.getStackTrace()) {
105            if (e.getClassName().equals(stopClass))
106               break;
107            if (e.getClassName().indexOf('$') == -1)
108               i ^= e.hashCode();
109         }
110         t = t.getCause();
111      }
112      return i;
113   }
114}
